main event: Multiple unidentified aerial objects were observed at Camp Hood, Texas on May 7, 1949, with various details noted such as their shape, color, altitude, speed, and direction of flight.
interesting points: The observed objects were described as being highly luminous, with some displaying red-green-white colors and diamond or domed disc shapes.
One object was reportedly 3 miles in width, while another was observed to cover 15 miles in 40 minutes horizontally.
A civilian type aircraft made an emergency landing near the restricted area, causing damage to the fencing.
Over 100 men and officers observed the phenomena, including field rates and college graduates, and no sound or odor was ever reported in relation to the sightings.
Flights of aircraft and all firing and training schedules were checked, but no incidents coincided in time and place with the observed phenomena.
witnesses: Multiple military personnel at Camp Hood, including field rates and college graduates
photographs: No photographs included in the report
